meanings.definition: To cause (a feeling or emotion) to become stronger or more intense.
meanings.sent1: The sad movie reinflames my tears every time I watch it.
meanings.sent2: His passionate speech reinflames our determination to make a change.
meanings.sent3: The cute puppy's antics reinflame our love for pets.
meanings.sent4: Her words reinflame the spark of hope in our hearts.
meanings.sent5: The beautiful sunset reinflames a sense of wonder in us.

meanings.definition: To ignite or provoke (conflict or tension) again.
meanings.sent1: The heated argument reinflames old disagreements between them.
meanings.sent2: The political debate reinflames tensions among the citizens.
meanings.sent3: The spilled juice reinflames the sibling rivalry over who caused the mess.
meanings.sent4: His careless remark reinflames the simmering anger in the room.
meanings.sent5: The controversial decision reinflames the debate within the community.
